review_blob: Big bomber bottle that looked better than it tasted. Disappointing overall with a foul fruity sourness that pervaded throughout. Never again!
Small bottle at a very nice noodle and sushi place in Japan town, San Francisco. Tasted like a warm ocean breeze (even though it was served cold) on a beautiful spring day. Very refreshing and light.
Draft at Harvey Milks in San Francisco. Just an average beer in an above average location --- the service there is memorable to say the least.
Draft at the Warwick hotel in San Francisco. This was an average IPA with below expectations results. Skip it if youre shopping for your next IPA.
Draft at the Warwick Hotel in San Francisco. An okay pilsner, really nothing to write home about but pretty good, especially on a hot day in California.
Draft at Magnolia Pub and Brewery in San Francisco. A very tasty and pleasant stout that left me surprised at the quality of ingredients and taste. Try it --- youll love it!
Draft at Mad Mex in Pittsburgh. This was okay, not to bad on all accounts. A nice and easy brown that goes down easy and tasty.
12 oz bottle from the sampler case. OK I guess, but nothing outstanding. I expected more from the pitch trying to sell this beer as something unique.
beer_name: Dark Horse Reserve Special Black Ale

review_blob: Bottle from Whole Foods in Haight Ashbury in San Francisco. One of the best stouts youll ever have. Dont miss this one.
Bomber bottle from Whole Foods in Haight Ashbury in San Francisco. Has a nice creamy taste, plenty of foam but not much else.

12 oz bottle from Whole Foods in Haight Ashbury in San Francisco. This was a pleasant surprise. Certainly it doesnt taste like sea water but it has a nice semi-bitter taste instead. Good if you enjoy a novelty beer.
12 oz can. Everything about this beer is light, including the fact that it has no flavor. Skip it the next time you have a choice of light beers.
12 oz bottle. A nice refreshing beer that goesnwell with practically anything in front of it.
12 oz bottle. Just an average run of the mill IPA that has a fancy label to go with it. Avoid if you can.
12 oz bottle. A nice holiday ale from the always reliable Great Lakes. Try one on for size.
12 oz bottle. A nice dry and not over the top wheat refresher. Try one on for size.
12 oz bottle. Just an average IPA all dressed up as something unique. Very skippable.
2915 vintage. A good imperial stout just short of extraordinary. One is probably enough.
beer_name: Stoudts Fat Dog Stout (Vintages 2004 and later)

review_blob: 12 oz bottle. This was very nice and a unique experience that bears repeating. Dont miss it!
12 oz bottle. Stinky and tasted like someone dissolved alcohol in a bottle of alcohol. To be avoided.
beer_name: Dark Horse Belgian Style Amber Ale

review_blob: Bomber bottle. This was an okay experience but Im left with a mouth feel full of perfume and flowers. Could have skipped it..
12 oz bottle. Not the besr pilsner in the world but not the worst either. Try it and decide for yourself.
12 oz bottle. A nice beer with a unique taste all to its own. Do it a favor and have one soon.
12 oz bottle. Just plain average --- nothing to rave about. Should have been better for a beer from Germany.
Snifter draft at Mex Mex in Pittsburgh. Too sweet and a bit stale. Way overdone on everything. Not for mass consumption.
12 oz bottle from Giant Eagle in Pittsburgh. This was just OK, not great but a valiant effort on the part of Wolaver. Worth a purchase and a taste.
12 oz bottle from Giant Eagle in Pittsburgh. This was just OK, not great but a valiant effort on the part of Long Trail. Worth a purchase and a taste.
12 oz bottle from Giant Eagle in Pittsburgh. This was an okay IPA variant but was still too dry and left a slight burn on the mouth. Loved the name but not the beer.

beer_brewer_name: Leinenkugel Brewing Company (Tenth & Blake Beer Co.)
review_blob: 12 oz can from the sampler case. These new flavored shandys have very little to offer the craft brew fan. This one has an insipid taste and a bad aftertaste, Not recommended at any price.

beer_brewer_name: Leinenkugel Brewing Company (Tenth & Blake Beer Co.)
review_blob: 12 oz can from the sampler case. These new flavored shandys have very little to offer the craft brew fan. This one has an insipid taste and a bad aftertaste, Not recommended at any price.

beer_brewer_name: Leinenkugel Brewing Company (Tenth & Blake Beer Co.)
review_blob: 12 oz can from the sampler case. These new flavored shandys have very little to offer the craft brew fan. This one has an insipid taste and a bad aftertaste, Not recommended at any price.
12 oz bottle from neighbor Bob - Thanks! Wow, this one really sucked! One of the worst ciders on the market. Just figures for a Miller product.
12 oz bottle from Giant Eagle in Pittsburgh. Way too wheaty and dry, I thought I was drinking liquid sandpaper. Not an enjoyable experience at all.
Tap at the Bridgetown Tavern in Ambridge, PA. Immediate tastes of heavy hops with an arid feel all the way down. The high alcohol is a plus.
12 oz bottle from Giant Eagle in Pittsburgh. Dark and tasty, perfect for a cold night to warm you up a bit. Not too heavy on the hops which is always good.
On site draft. Weak, under flavored and diluted to the maximum. Why cant this brewery produce anything that isnt a counterfeit to the real thing?
On site draft. Weak, under flavored and diluted to the maximum. Why cant this brewery produce anything that isnt a counterfeit to the real thing?
Bottle from neinghbor Bob - thanks! Whew, how awful can it get? The whole thing tasted like a liquid tic-tac. Stay far away.

12 oz bottle from Giant Eagle in Pittsburgh. This was quite a beer just waiting to be discovered for all its goodness! Sweet and spicy, lost of brown sugars and just enough hops. Get it while its out there.
12 oz draft at Mad Mex in Pittsburgh. Chewy and delicious. Some hints of tar and dark sugars. A slight banana finish.
12 oz bottle. Lots of good chewy awesomeness. Some hints of tar and molasses. Worth every penny.
Draft at The Pleasure Bar in Pittsburgh. Immediate head on collision with chocolate in a creamy smooth slide all the way down. Might be better than Sam Smiths Organic Chocolate Stout.
Sampler tap from the flight at the Washington, DC location. A tad thin and far too hop infused, I left feeling that the brewery was skimping on ingredients. Not satisfied at all.
Sampler tap from the flight at the Washington, DC location. A tad thin and not quite interesting enough, I left feeling that the brewery was skimping on ingredients. Not satisfied at all.
Sampler tap from the flight at the Washington, DC location. A tad thin and not quite dark enough, I left feeling that the brewery was skimping on ingredients. Not satisfied at all.
Sampler from the flight of beers at the Washington, D.C. location. Unfiltered with heavy yeast and a hint of cloves.
Sampler from the flight of beers at the Washington, D.C. location. Light and refreshing with a clean and crispy finish.
Sampler from the flight of beers at the Washington, D.C. location Sweet and very fresh with a malty taste throughout.
Sampler from the flight of beers at the Washington, D.C. location. Fresh and malty with an unfiltered taste throughout.
12oz bottle. Taste was good overall, perhaps a bit dry and tart but thisis to be expected for these types. Worth the price.
